item.title: Plex Meta Manager Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the upstream project rebranding, we have decided to deprecate our Plex Meta Manager container. Please migrate to our new Kometa image instead.
item.content: Due to the upstream project rebranding, we have decided to deprecate our Plex Meta Manager container. Please migrate to our new Kometa image instead.

item.title: endlessh Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to a lack of upstream development, we have decided to deprecate our endlessh container.
item.content: Due to a lack of upstream development, we have decided to deprecate our endlessh container.

item.title: Dillinger Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to a lack of upstream development, we have decided to deprecate our dillinger container.
item.content: Due to a lack of upstream development, we have decided to deprecate our dillinger container.

item.title: Unifi Controller Deprecation
item.description: As we previously announced, due to the way in which Ubiquiti package and distribute their software our Unifi Controller container has reached a point where we cannot upgrade to newer supported packages without making breaking changes to the image. As a result we have now deprecated our Unifi Controller container and replaced it with a new Unifi Network Application container. This new container uses our current base images and a separate mongodb instance, which makes it substantially easier for us to maintain going forward.
item.content:
As we previously announced, due to the way in which Ubiquiti package and distribute their software our Unifi Controller container has reached a point where we cannot upgrade to newer supported packages without making breaking changes to the image.

As a result we have now deprecated our Unifi Controller container and replaced it with a new Unifi Network Application container. This new container uses our current base images and a separate mongodb instance, which makes it substantially easier for us to maintain going forward.

The new container is not a drop-in replacement and it is crucial that you read the entire Application Setup section of the readme before attempting to migrate an existing install

Those of you who have been using our mongoless tag for the Unifi Controller container can switch directly to the Unifi Network Application container without needing to perform any migration steps.

item.title: Domoticz Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to upstream project being unwilling to build against a supported version of openssl, we have decided to deprecate our domoticz container.
item.content: Due to upstream project being unwilling to build against a supported version of openssl, we have decided to deprecate our domoticz container.

item.title: Unifi Controller Deprecation Reminder
item.description: As we previously announced, due to the way in which Ubiquiti package and distribute their software our Unifi Controller container has reached a point where we cannot upgrade to newer supported packages without making breaking changes to the image. As a result we have decided to deprecate our Unifi Controller container and replace it with a new Unifi Network Application container. This new container uses our current base images and a separate mongodb instance, which makes it substantially easier for us to maintain going forward.
item.content:
As we previously announced, due to the way in which Ubiquiti package and distribute their software our Unifi Controller container has reached a point where we cannot upgrade to newer supported packages without making breaking changes to the image.

As a result we have decided to deprecate our Unifi Controller container and replace it with a new Unifi Network Application container. This new container uses our current base images and a separate mongodb instance, which makes it substantially easier for us to maintain going forward.

We will continue to support our Unifi Controller image until 2024-01-01, at which point you will need to have migrated to the Unifi Network Application container to continue to receive support.

The new container is not a drop-in replacement and it is crucial that you read the entire Application Setup section of the readme before attempting to migrate an existing install

Those of you who have been using our mongoless tag for the Unifi Controller container can switch directly to the Unifi Network Application container without needing to perform any migration steps.

item.title: EmbyStat Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to upstream project no longer being actively developed per this update, we have decided to deprecate our EmbyStat container.
item.content: Due to upstream project no longer being actively developed per this update, we have decided to deprecate our EmbyStat container.

item.title: Headphones Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to compatibility and build issues caused by a lack of upstream development, we have decided to deprecate our Headphones container.
item.content: Due to compatibility and build issues caused by a lack of upstream development, we have decided to deprecate our Headphones container.

item.title: Unifi Controller Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the way in which Ubiquiti package and distribute their software our Unifi Controller container has reached a point where we cannot upgrade to newer supported packages without making breaking changes to the image. As a result we have decided to deprecate our Unifi Controller container and replace it with a new Unifi Network Application container. This new container uses our current base images and a separate mongodb instance, which makes it substantially easier for us to maintain going forward.
item.content:
Due to the way in which Ubiquiti package and distribute their software our Unifi Controller container has reached a point where we cannot upgrade to newer supported packages without making breaking changes to the image.

As a result we have decided to deprecate our Unifi Controller container and replace it with a new Unifi Network Application container. This new container uses our current base images and a separate mongodb instance, which makes it substantially easier for us to maintain going forward.

We will continue to support our Unifi Controller image until 2024-01-01, at which point you will need to have migrated to the Unifi Network Application container to continue to receive support.

The new container is not a drop-in replacement and it is crucial that you read the entire Application Setup section of the readme before attempting to migrate an existing install

Those of you who have been using our mongoless tag for the Unifi Controller container can switch directly to the Unifi Network Application container without needing to perform any migration steps.

item.title: Nano Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to issues with maintaining security updates for our private Nano network, we have decided to shut down our forked network. This includes the archival of code related to its suite of accompanying images for nano, nano-wallet, and nano-discord-bot. The web wallet which seems to be still functional when connected to an RPC server will stay online for the forseeable future.
item.content: Due to issues with maintaining security updates for our private Nano network, we have decided to shut down our forked network. This includes the archival of code related to its suite of accompanying images for nano, nano-wallet, and nano-discord-bot. The web wallet which seems to be still functional when connected to an RPC server will stay online for the forseeable future.

item.title: 32-bit Arm Deprecation Notice
item.description: As we previously announced, due to the ever-decreasing support for modern apps and packages on 32-bit Arm platforms, we have now deprecated all 32-bit Arm (armhf) versions of our images effective today, 2023-07-01. Old images will continue to work, but will not receive application or OS updates, and we will not provide support for them. Additionally, the latest and arm32v7-latest tags will no longer work for 32-bit Arm, you will need to provide a specific version tag if you wish to pull one of the old images.
item.content:
As we previously announced, due to the ever-decreasing support for modern apps and packages on 32-bit Arm platforms, we have now deprecated all 32-bit Arm (armhf) versions of our images effective today, 2023-07-01.

Old images will continue to work, but will not receive application or OS updates, and we will not provide support for them. Additionally, the latest and arm32v7-latest tags will no longer work for 32-bit Arm, you will need to provide a specific version tag if you wish to pull one of the old images.

Due to the number of images and how our build pipelines work it may take several days for the builds to complete and documentation to update to reflect the changes.

Please read our blog post on the matter for more details.

item.title: Reminder: 32-bit Arm Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the ever-decreasing support for modern apps and packages on 32-bit Arm platforms, we will be deprecating all 32-bit Arm (armhf) versions of our images effective 2023-07-01. Please read our blog post on the matter for more details.
item.content:
Due to the ever-decreasing support for modern apps and packages on 32-bit Arm platforms, we will be deprecating all 32-bit Arm (armhf) versions of our images effective 2023-07-01.

Please read our blog post on the matter for more details.

item.title: COPS Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to numerous compatibility issues caused by the upstream project being abandoned and no actively maintained fork existing, we are deprecating our COPS container.
item.content: Due to numerous compatibility issues caused by the upstream project being abandoned and no actively maintained fork existing, we are deprecating our COPS container.

item.title: Reminder: 32-bit Arm Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the ever-decreasing support for modern apps and packages on 32-bit Arm platforms, we will be deprecating all 32-bit Arm (armhf) versions of our images effective 2023-07-01. Please read our blog post on the matter for more details.
item.content:
Due to the ever-decreasing support for modern apps and packages on 32-bit Arm platforms, we will be deprecating all 32-bit Arm (armhf) versions of our images effective 2023-07-01.

Please read our blog post on the matter for more details.

item.title: Home Assistant 32-bit ARM Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to build issues on 32-bit ARM, we are deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our Home Assistant container. The last supported tags for 32-bit ARM will be 2023.4.6-ls141. If you are currently running the Home Assistant image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it. Please see our blog post regarding our support policy for armhf.
item.content:
Due to build issues on 32-bit ARM, we are deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our Home Assistant container.

The last supported tags for 32-bit ARM will be 2023.4.6-ls141.

If you are currently running the Home Assistant image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it. Please see our blog post regarding our support policy for armhf.

item.title: Calibre-Web 32-bit ARM Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to issues building required dependencies on 32-bit Arm, we have taken the decision to deprecate the 32-bit Arm (armhf) version of our Calibre-Web image. The last supported tag for 32-bit Arm will be 0.6.20-ls204 for the stable branch and nightly-6c6841f8-ls67 for nightly. If you are currently running the Calibre-Web image on a 32-bit Arm platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it.
item.content:
Due to issues building required dependencies on 32-bit Arm, we have taken the decision to deprecate the 32-bit Arm (armhf) version of our Calibre-Web image.

The last supported tag for 32-bit Arm will be 0.6.20-ls204 for the stable branch and nightly-6c6841f8-ls67 for nightly.

If you are currently running the Calibre-Web image on a 32-bit Arm platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it. Please see our blog post regarding our support policy for armhf.

item.title: 32-bit Arm Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the ever-decreasing support for modern apps and packages on 32-bit Arm platforms, we will be deprecating all 32-bit Arm (armhf) versions of our images effective 2023-07-01. Please read our blog post on the matter for more details.
item.content:
Due to the ever-decreasing support for modern apps and packages on 32-bit Arm platforms, we will be deprecating all 32-bit Arm (armhf) versions of our images effective 2023-07-01.

Please read our blog post on the matter for more details.

item.title: TVheadend 32-bit ARM Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to build issues on 32-bit ARM, we are deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our TVheadend container. The last supported tags for 32-bit ARM will be 02987438-ls151. If you are currently running the TVheadend image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it. Please see our blog post regarding our support policy for armhf.
item.content:

The last supported tags for 32-bit ARM will be 02987438-ls151.

If you are currently running the TVheadend image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it. Please see our blog post regarding our support policy for armhf.

item.title: Docker Compose Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to changes is upstream distribution, we are deprecating our Docker Compose container. Docker Compose is now available from the official Docker repos. Current and previous releases can also be downloaded directly from their GitHub repo.
item.content:
Due to changes is upstream distribution, we are deprecating our Docker Compose container.

Docker Compose is now available from the official Docker repos.

Current and previous releases can also be downloaded directly from their GitHub repo.

item.title: guacd Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to a lack of upstream support for modern dependencies, we are deprecating our guacd container. We recommend switching to their official container, though please note this only offers support for amd64 platforms.
item.content:
Due to a lack of upstream support for modern dependencies, we are deprecating our guacd container.

We recommend switching to their official container, though please note this only offers support for amd64 platforms.

item.title: Papermerge Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to issues maintaining parity with the upstream container releases, we are deprecating our Papermerge container. We recommend switching to their official container. Their documentation can be found here.
item.content:
Due to issues maintaining parity with the upstream container releases, we are deprecating our Papermerge container.

We recommend switching to their official container.

Their documentation can be found here.

item.title: nzbhydra2 32-bit ARM Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the lack of upstream packages for 32-bit ARM preventing improvements to the image, we will be deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our nzbhydra2 image on 2023-03-31. We will announce the last supported tag for 32-bit ARM at that time. If you are currently running the nzbhydra2 image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it.
item.content:
Due to the lack of upstream packages for 32-bit ARM preventing improvements to the image, we will be deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our nzbhydra2 image on 2023-03-31.

We will announce the last supported tag for 32-bit ARM at that time.

If you are currently running the nzbhydra2 image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it. Please see our blog post regarding our support policy for armhf.

item.title: nzbget Deprecation Notice
item.description: Follow up for https://info.linuxserver.io/issues/2022-11-27-nzbget/ Due to the upstream project no longer being in development, we are deprecating our nzbget container. We are monitoring activity of forks of the original nzbget and may release a separate image if a viable option presents itself. Please consider switching to SABnzbd.
item.content:
Follow up for https://info.linuxserver.io/issues/2022-11-27-nzbget/

Due to the upstream project no longer being in development, we are deprecating our nzbget container.

We are monitoring activity of forks of the original nzbget and may release a separate image if a viable option presents itself.

Please consider switching to SABnzbd.

item.title: Booksonic Air 32-bit ARM Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the lack of support for modern Java runtime packages on 32-bit ARM from the Alpine repos, we will shortly be deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our Booksonic Air image. The last supported tag for 32-bit ARM will be v2201.1.0-ls77. If you are currently running the Booksonic Air image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it.
item.content:
Due to the lack of support for modern Java runtime packages on 32-bit ARM from the Alpine repos, we will shortly be deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our Booksonic Air image.

The last supported tag for 32-bit ARM will be v2201.1.0-ls77.

If you are currently running the Booksonic Air image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it. Please see our blog post regarding our support policy for armhf.

item.title: nzbget Deprecation Notice

item.content:
Due to the upstream project no longer being in development, we will be deprecating our nzbget container on December 31, 2022.

Please consider switching to SABnzbd.

item.title: Paperless-ngx Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to issues maintaining parity with the upstream container releases, we are deprecating our Paperless-ng container. We recommend switching to their official container Paperless-ngx While the volume mounts are different, it should be a drop-in replacement.
item.content:
Due to issues maintaining parity with the upstream container releases, we are deprecating our Paperless-ng container.

We recommend switching to their official container Paperless-ngx

While the volume mounts are different, it should be a drop-in replacement.

item.title: Duplicati 32-bit ARM Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the lack of reliable support for Mono on 32-bit ARM, we will shortly be deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our Duplicati container. The last supported tags for 32-bit ARM will be v2.0.6.3-2.0.6.3_beta_2021-06-17-ls135 for the stable branch and development-v2.0.6.104-2.0.6.104_canary_2022-06-15-ls89 for the development branch. If you are currently running the Duplicati image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it.
item.content:
Due to the lack of reliable support for Mono on 32-bit ARM, we will shortly be deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our Duplicati container.

The last supported tags for 32-bit ARM will be v2.0.6.3-2.0.6.3_beta_2021-06-17-ls135 for the stable branch and development-v2.0.6.104-2.0.6.104_canary_2022-06-15-ls89 for the development branch.

If you are currently running the Duplicati image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it. Please see our blog post regarding our support policy for armhf.

item.title: Sonarr 32-bit ARM Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the lack of reliable support for Mono on 32-bit ARM, we will shortly be deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our Sonarr container. The last supported tags for 32-bit ARM will be 3.0.8.1507-ls151 for the stable branch and develop-3.0.8.1540-ls294 for the develop branch. If you are currently running the Sonarr image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it.
item.content:
Due to the lack of reliable support for Mono on 32-bit ARM, we will shortly be deprecating the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our Sonarr container.

The last supported tags for 32-bit ARM will be 3.0.8.1507-ls151 for the stable branch and develop-3.0.8.1540-ls294 for the develop branch.

If you are currently running the Sonarr image on a 32-bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64-bit OS if your hardware supports it. Please see our blog post regarding our support policy for armhf.

item.title: Cloud9 Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the lack of upstream support and overhead maintaining our own fork of the codebase, we will shortly be deprecating our Cloud9 container. We recommend looking at our code-server and openvscode-server containers as potential replacements.
item.content:
Due to the lack of upstream support and overhead maintaining our own fork of the codebase, we will shortly be deprecating our Cloud9 container.

We recommend looking at our code-server and openvscode-server containers as potential replacements.

item.title: Kanzi Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the lack of an active maintainer, and 2 years without an upstream release, we are deprecating our Kanzi container.
item.content: Due to the lack of an active maintainer, and 2 years without an upstream release, we are deprecating our Kanzi container.

item.title: Scrutiny Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to issues maintaining parity with the upstream container releases, we are deprecating our Scrutiny container. We recommend switching to the official Docker images.
item.content:
Due to issues maintaining parity with the upstream container releases, we are deprecating our Scrutiny container.

We recommend switching to the official Docker images.

item.title: Chevereto Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the ending of upstream support for the free version of Chevereto, we will shortly be deprecating our container. We recommend looking at alternative images such as pixapop, piwigo, or photoshow.
item.content:
Due to the ending of upstream support for the free version of Chevereto, we will shortly be deprecating our container.

We recommend looking at alternative images such as pixapop, piwigo, or photoshow.

item.title: Unifi Controller 32-bit ARM Deprecation Notice
item.description: As per our previous announcement today sees the deprecation of the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our Unifi Controller image. The last functional armhf tag will be 7.1.66-ls151. If you are currently running the Unifi Controller image on a 32 bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64 bit OS if your hardware supports it.
item.content:
As per our previous announcement today sees the deprecation of the 32-bit ARM (armhf) version of our Unifi Controller image. The last functional armhf tag will be 7.1.66-ls151.

If you are currently running the Unifi Controller image on a 32 bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64 bit OS if your hardware supports it.

item.title: Couchpotato Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the upstream project no longer being maintained, we have made the decision to deprecate our Couchpotato image. The image will immediately cease to be supported and will not receive any further updates. Users of the image may wish to look at our Radarr image as an alternative.
item.content:
Due to the upstream project no longer being maintained, we have made the decision to deprecate our Couchpotato image. The image will immediately cease to be supported and will not receive any further updates.

Users of the image may wish to look at our Radarr image as an alternative.

item.title: Kodi-Headless Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to the lack of an active maintainer, we have made the decision to deprecate our kodi-headless image. The image will immediately cease to be supported and will not receive any further updates. Users of the image are advised to switch to this fork of the image by matthuisman instead.
item.content:
Due to the lack of an active maintainer, we have made the decision to deprecate our kodi-headless image. The image will immediately cease to be supported and will not receive any further updates.

Users of the image are advised to switch to this fork of the image by matthuisman instead.

item.title: pyLoad Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to a dependency on Python2 and Alpine 3.12, both of which are already or approaching end of support, we have made the decision to deprecate our pyLoad image. The image will immediately cease to be supported and will not receive any further updates. Users of the image are advised to switch to our new pyLoad-ng image as a replacement.
item.content:
Due to a dependency on Python2 and Alpine 3.12, both of which are already or approaching end of support, we have made the decision to deprecate our pyLoad image. The image will immediately cease to be supported and will not receive any further updates.

Users of the image are advised to switch to our new pyLoad-ng image as a replacement.

item.title: Clarkson Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to ending of support by the upstream project, we have made the decision to deprecate our Clarkson image. The image will immediately cease to be supported and will not receive any further updates. Users of the image are advised to look at Hammond as a possible replacement.
item.content:
Due to ending of support by the upstream project, we have made the decision to deprecate our Clarkson image. The image will immediately cease to be supported and will not receive any further updates.

Users of the image are advised to look at Hammond as a possible replacement.

item.title: Airsonic Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to ending of support by the upstream project, we have made the decision to deprecate our Airsonic image. The image will immediately cease to be supported and will not receive any further updates. Users of the image are advised to switch to our Airsonic-Advanced image instead.
item.content:
Due to ending of support by the upstream project, we have made the decision to deprecate our Airsonic image. The image will immediately cease to be supported and will not receive any further updates.

Users of the image are advised to switch to our Airsonic-Advanced image instead.

item.title: qBittorrent change to Alpine
item.description: Due to the upstream project dropping support for Ubuntu LTS (Focal) in their most recent release (v4.4.0) we have decided to switch our qBittorrent container to our Alpine baseimage. We apologise for the short notice but we didn’t have sufficient information from the upstream project to make these decisions in advance. If you need to stay on the existing Ubuntu-based image with v4.3.9 of qBittorrent you may pin your install to the version-14.
item.content:
Due to the upstream project dropping support for Ubuntu LTS (Focal) in their most recent release (v4.4.0) we have decided to switch our qBittorrent container to our Alpine baseimage. We apologise for the short notice but we didn’t have sufficient information from the upstream project to make these decisions in advance.

If you need to stay on the existing Ubuntu-based image with v4.3.9 of qBittorrent you may pin your install to the version-14.3.9.99202110311443-7435-01519b5e7ubuntu20.04.1 tag. Please be aware that this image will not receive any further updates.

This change should not affect most users, however, if you rely on custom scripts or 3rd party packages you may need to make changes to ensure they continue to function as before.

Additionally - if you make use of the qbt CLI tool - as part of this change we have switched from using https://github.com/fedarovich/qbittorrent-cli, which does not provide Alpine-compatible binaries, to https://github.com/ludviglundgren/qbittorrent-cli which does. While these tools are very similar in function, the syntax differs between them.

item.title: qBittorrent Unstable Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to a lack of upstream support for Ubuntu LTS (Focal), we have made the decision to deprecate our qBittorrent Unstable image. Support and updates for the image will cease immediately. If you are currently running the Unstable image we recommend switching to the Stable image. If and when the upstream project start building Unstable packages for Ubuntu LTS we will look to reinstate the image.
item.content:
Due to a lack of upstream support for Ubuntu LTS (Focal), we have made the decision to deprecate our qBittorrent Unstable image. Support and updates for the image will cease immediately.

If you are currently running the Unstable image we recommend switching to the Stable image. If and when the upstream project start building Unstable packages for Ubuntu LTS we will look to reinstate the image.

item.title: Unifi Controller 32-bit ARM Deprecation Notice
item.description: Due to a lack of upstream support for mongodb on 32 bit platforms, we have made the decision to deprecate our 32 bit ARM (also known as armhf / armv7) Unifi Controller image. We will continue to update the image until June 2022 at which point it will cease to be supported. If you are currently running the Unifi Controller image on a 32 bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64 bit OS if your hardware supports it.
item.content:
Due to a lack of upstream support for mongodb on 32 bit platforms, we have made the decision to deprecate our 32 bit ARM (also known as armhf / armv7) Unifi Controller image. We will continue to update the image until June 2022 at which point it will cease to be supported.

If you are currently running the Unifi Controller image on a 32 bit ARM platform we recommend you look at alternative options such as upgrading to a 64 bit OS if your hardware supports it.

item.title: Airsonic Deprecation
item.description: As stated by the airsonic team here, Airsonic is now no longer maintained and is recommended to use airsonic-advanced. We’re currently looking into creating an AirSonic-Advanced image and will post an update when this has been released. For the time being we will continue to let our airsonic builds update dependencies but once airsonic-advanced is released that will be stopped.
item.content: As stated by the airsonic team here, Airsonic is now no longer maintained and is recommended to use airsonic-advanced. We’re currently looking into creating an AirSonic-Advanced image and will post an update when this has been released. For the time being we will continue to let our airsonic builds update dependencies but once airsonic-advanced is released that will be stopped.

item.title: mariadb change to Alpine
item.description: As previously announced we have now moved the MariaDB :alpine tag to :latest and deprecated our Ubuntu-based image. No user action is required when updating to the new tag, but as ever we recommend ensuring you have a proven backup of your data before performing any updates. Going forward, the :alpine tag will not receive any further updates. If for some reason you need to remain on the old version, you can pin your install to the version-110.
item.content:
As previously announced we have now moved the MariaDB :alpine tag to :latest and deprecated our Ubuntu-based image. No user action is required when updating to the new tag, but as ever we recommend ensuring you have a proven backup of your data before performing any updates. Going forward, the :alpine tag will not receive any further updates.

If for some reason you need to remain on the old version, you can pin your install to the version-110.4.21mariabionic tag, although please be aware that no further updates will be provided for it.

item.title: openvpn-as is being deprecated
item.description: Our openvpn-as image is being deprecated. While it will still be available, no new version will be built. We recommend users take a look at our wireguard image as a possible replacement.
item.content: Our openvpn-as image is being deprecated. While it will still be available, no new version will be built. We recommend users take a look at our wireguard image as a possible replacement.

item.title: ruTorrent is being deprecated
item.description: Our ruTorrent image is being deprecated. While it will still be available, no new version will be built. We are directing anyone still interested in using rTorrent / ruTorrent in docker to crazy-max’s container. If you are interested in taking over as a maintainer, please see this issue.
item.content: Our ruTorrent image is being deprecated. While it will still be available, no new version will be built. We are directing anyone still interested in using rTorrent / ruTorrent in docker to crazy-max’s container. If you are interested in taking over as a maintainer, please see this issue.

item.title: mariadb change to Alpine
item.description: We have created a new alpine based version of our mariadb container. Our intent is to move :alpine tag to :latest once ready. Further info on the timeline will follow in the coming weeks.
item.content: We have created a new alpine based version of our mariadb container. Our intent is to move :alpine tag to :latest once ready. Further info on the timeline will follow in the coming weeks.
